content_blocks.title: DCSync Attack

content.text: This lesson covers: Directory replication, Credential dumping, Domain compromise, Detection. These are advanced techniques requiring solid fundamentals.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Core concept: Directory replication enables attackers (or defenders) to replicating active directory credentials.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Real threat actors use DCSync Attack daily in active campaigns.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: What security controls could prevent or detect this technique?

content_blocks.title: Attack Simulation

content.scenario: You've compromised an account with replication rights. Extract all domain credentials.
steps: Extract KRBTGT, admin, and user hashes
detection: Monitor replication requests from non-DC systems
Alert on Event ID 4662 with replication GUIDs

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Follow this attack path step-by-step to understand the adversary perspective.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: This exact attack path has been observed in real breaches.
content_blocks.reflection_prompt: How would you detect each step of this attack?

post_assessment.question: What does DCSync abuse?
post_assessment.explanation: DCSync abuses directory replication (DS-Replication-Get-Changes) to extract credentials from domain controllers.

post_assessment.question: What permissions are needed for DCSync?
post_assessment.explanation: DCSync requires replication rights: DS-Replication-Get-Changes and DS-Replication-Get-Changes-All.
